Theoretical High Energy Physics.Research Area/Description: Research focuses on elementary particle physics, physics beyond the Standard Model, exploring various open questions related to the Higgs boson, top quark physics, proton spin, neutrino physics, flavor physics, unified theories, supersymmetry, topological quantum field theories, AdS-CFT correspondence, astroparticle physics, and early universe cosmology including matter-antimatter asymmetry, dark matter, and inflationary paradigm.

Ongoing Projects.project_name: Higgs and Top quark physics in beyond Standard Model (bSM) models
Ongoing Projects.description: Exploring collider signatures of new physics contributions to Higgs and top quark observables, through polarization and jet substructure studies both at the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) and the proposed International Linear Collider (ILC).
Investigating how the proton's spin is built up from the intrinsic spin of quarks and gluons and their orbital angular momentum.
Exploring the smallness of neutrino masses, their mixings, mass hierarchy, CP violation, and Majorana nature.
Investigating the masses and mixings of fermions in the Standard Model, CP violating parameters, and their connection to baryon asymmetry.

Studying supersymmetry and its implications for the standard Higgs, exploring left-right symmetric extended supersymmetric models and their ability to explain matter-antimatter asymmetry and neutrino mass.

Ongoing Projects.project_name: Topological Quantum Field Theories and knot theory
Ongoing Projects.description: Working on knot polynomials using Chern-Simons topological field theory.
Utilizing string theory-gauge theory dualities to understand counting of BPS states and transport properties like shear viscosity to entropy density ratio.
Exploring mechanisms for generating matter-antimatter asymmetry in the early universe, including the role of topological defects.
Investigating the particle nature of dark matter and potential candidates within extended models.
Studying the properties of the inflaton field and its impact on the Cosmic Microwave Background Radiation.

research_areas.description: Focuses on developing advanced theory, algorithms, and codes to explain various properties of materials (crystal structure, magnetism, transport) in both 3D bulk materials and low-dimensional systems (graphene, nanotubes, clusters). Utilizes theoretical modeling and first-principles calculations based on Density Functional Theory.

Research focuses on a variety of material systems, including magnetic materials (ferrites, oxide/nitride semiconductors, organic semiconductors), metallic compounds, multilayer thin films, Heuslar alloys, spin chain compounds, intermetallics,  artificial diamond films, and graphene-based sensors and chemical filters.

ongoing_projects.name: Growth of Magnetic Materials
ongoing_projects.description: Using Pulsed Laser Deposition (PLD), Chemical Vapor Deposition (CVD), and Langmuir Blodgett systems to grow ferrites, oxide/nitride semiconductors, and organic semiconductors.

ongoing_projects.name: High Pressure High Temperature Synthesis
ongoing_projects.description: Producing metallic compounds with uncommon metal ion oxidation states.

ongoing_projects.name: Spintronic Applications of Heuslar Alloys and Multilayer Thin Films
ongoing_projects.description: Investigating spin and electronic structure correlations in Heuslar alloys and multilayer thin films for spintronic applications.

ongoing_projects.name: Spin Interactions and Phases in Spin Chain Compounds and Intermetallics
ongoing_projects.description: Studying spin glass and spin liquid behavior in spin chain compounds and intermetallics using solid-state NMR to understand fundamental spin-spin interactions.

ongoing_projects.name: Artificial Diamond Films for Radiation-Hard Detectors
ongoing_projects.description: Developing artificial diamond films using Microwave Plasma CVD for high-energy particle detector applications.

ongoing_projects.name: Graphene-based Sensors and Chemical Filters
ongoing_projects.description: Developing sensors and chemical filters based on graphene nanomaterials.

additional_details.facilities: PLD/CVD, Langmuir Blodgett systems, High Pressure High Temperature furnace, Solid State NMR, Microwave Plasma CVD, AFM, High resolution X-ray diffraction, Surface chemical Analyser (ESCA), Class 10,000 cleanroom with photolithography, rapid thermal annealing, chip scribing, and ultrasonic wire bonding, Cryogenic facility with liquid Helium, Magneto-transport and SQUID magnetometry down to 300 mK.

research.research_area: Soft Matter, Biophysics, and Nonlinear Dynamics
research.description: Research in this area spans theoretical and experimental investigations of soft matter (polymers, granular matter, driven poly-crystals), biological physics (active matter, gene regulation, epigenetics, cellular dynamics, mechanics of cell division, shape transformations), and nonlinear dynamics (electrical circuits, electrochemical systems, stochastic delay differential equations).  The work builds upon the foundations of statistical mechanics and extends to non-equilibrium processes and nonlinear phenomena.

research_areas.description: Explores light-matter interactions in various physical systems to understand fundamental concepts and develop novel technologies. Focuses on nonlinear optics, ultrafast phenomena, molecular spectroscopy, nano-optics and plasmonics, organic LEDs and devices.

additional_details.facilities: Labs and central facilities at IIT Bombay
courses_offered: Introduction to Atomic and Molecular Physics

research_areas.description: Research encompasses observational astrophysics, gravitational wave physics and astronomy, dark matter studies, and early-universe cosmology.

ongoing_projects.name: LIGO Scientific Collaboration

ongoing_projects.name: Dark Matter Research

ongoing_projects.name: Early Universe Cosmology Research
ongoing_projects.description: Investigation of topics such as the origin of magnetic fields in galaxies, using cosmic microwave background to probe new physics, and black hole physics.

facilities: 0.7m autonomous optical telescope at Hanle, Ladakh

research_areas.description: Studies the universe from a 'software' perspective, analyzing the information theoretic content of physical processes, combined with a 'hardware' perspective of fundamental laws. Focuses on physical problems including quantum technologies, light-matter interactions, and quantum networks.

Research_facilities.Description: Used for identifying the crystalline phases present in a powder sample and for determining structural properties.
Research_facilities.Additional Details: Booking procedure: Download Form. Submit on (M/W/F) between 2-5 PM, Contact: A.V. Mahajan

Research_facilities.Description: A system used to characterize the physical properties of materials, including magnetic properties.
A furnace capable of reaching high pressures and temperatures for material synthesis and processing.
Used to image surfaces at the nanoscale level by scanning a sharp probe over the sample.
Uses a focused beam of electrons to create images of a sample, providing high-resolution surface information.
Used to measure the absorbance and transmittance of samples across the ultraviolet, visible, and near-infrared spectral range.
Used for depositing thin films of materials by heating a source material in a vacuum.
Used to create uniform thin films on flat substrates by spinning the substrate at high speed while dispensing a liquid solution.
Uses visible light and a system of lenses to magnify images of small samples.
Produces and recovers liquid helium for cryogenic experiments.

Research_facilities.Facility Name: Mask Aligner for Sample Size Upto 4 Inches
Research_facilities.Description: Used for photolithography, a process for creating patterned thin films.
Used for rapid thermal processing of materials, including annealing and oxidation.

Research_facilities.Facility Name: Class 10,000 Clean-Room Facility with Approx 350 sqft Floor Area
Research_facilities.Description: A controlled environment with a low level of pollutants, suitable for fabrication and characterization of sensitive devices.
Allows for sequential deposition of different materials without breaking vacuum.
Used to make electrical connections between microchips and other components using ultrasonic energy.

Research_facilities.Facility Name: He-3 Cryostat (Base Temperature ~250 mK) with 9T Superconducting Magnet and Sample Rotation Capability (Oxford Instruments)
Research_facilities.Description: Provides extremely low temperatures and high magnetic fields for studying the behavior of materials at cryogenic temperatures.
Generates picosecond laser pulses with adjustable wavelength.
A femtosecond laser used for ultrafast spectroscopy and other applications.

Research_facilities.Facility Name: Closed Cycle Refrigerators x3 (Janis/ CTI Cryogenics)
Research_facilities.Description: Provide cooling for experiments at cryogenic temperatures without consuming liquid cryogens.

Research_facilities.Facility Name: Optical Components (Lenses, Mirrors, Polarizers, Waveplate, Prisms, Gratings etc)
Research_facilities.Description: A collection of various optical components for building and modifying optical setups.
